definition: variant of 老家伙[lao3 jia1 huo5]

prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough

home/family/(polite) my (sister, uncle etc)/classifier for families or businesses/refers to the philosophical schools of pre-Han China/noun suffix for a specialist in some activity, such as a musician or revolutionary, corresponding to English -ist, -er, -ary or -ian/CL:個|个[ge4]
meals (abbr. for 伙食[huo3 shi2])/variant of 夥|伙[huo3]
companion/partner/group/classifier for groups of people/to combine/together

sentences.english: Surrounded by guardsoul the little guy can perish the old guy thoroughly.
sentences.chinese: 被守护魄环绕着的小家伙能彻底毁灭老家伙。

sentences.english: Does it bother you if I stir it with my fingers, old-timer?
sentences.chinese: 介意我用指头搅拌一下吗，老家伙？

sentences.english: Who's the old scag sitting next to him?
sentences.chinese: 坐他旁边的老家伙是谁？

sentences.english: That old boy is going to explode soon.
sentences.chinese: 老家伙马上就要气炸了。

sentences.english: Are these wise, old heads being overlooked?
sentences.chinese: 这些精明的老家伙们被忽视了么？

sentences.english: The first old man stepped up to the tee and hit.
sentences.chinese: 第一个老家伙走到发球区，打了一杆。

sentences.english: George eis a funny old bugger.
sentences.chinese: 乔治是个有趣的老家伙。

sentences.english: That boring old bugger in the pub that nobody wants to sit beside.
sentences.chinese: 你会变成酒馆里那个没人理的无聊的老家伙。

sentences.english: I destroyed the old one in vengeance.
sentences.chinese: 作为报复，我干掉了那个老家伙。

sentences.english: What are you doing, you silly old bugger?
sentences.chinese: 你想干什么，你这个愚蠢的老家伙？

sentences.english: She wants me to meet one of those poisoned oldie 's families.
sentences.chinese: 她想让我见个被毒死的老家伙的家人。

sentences.english: George is a funny old bugger.
sentences.chinese: 乔治是个有趣的老家伙。

sentences.english: "you thellonk too much, old man, " he said aloud.
sentences.chinese: “你想患上太多了，老家伙，”他说作声来。

sentences.english: Once, a rich old man met Abernathy at a party.
sentences.chinese: 一次，一个富有的老家伙在一次宴会上碰到哈伯玛斯。

definition: (derog.) old but still alive/old fart/old bastard
(coll.) old man/(said of an aging husband) my old man
(literary) youngster/(old) young fellow (term of address used by the older generation)/(old) I, me (used in speaking to one's elders)
household dish, implement or furniture/domestic animal/(coll.) guy/chap/weapon
see 老頭子|老头子[lao3 tou2 zi5]
